body:
I went to clean up my aging installs, and deleted all the files.  I did not
update `~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml`, so it still pointed to  several compilers that
no longer existed.

I went to do various installs, and they all failed with errors that did not indicate
the problem was with the compiler.  I think spack should report an error like:

```
    gcc@7.3.0 specified in ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml does not exist
```
title: spack does not report error when compiler is missing
